text: :thumbsup:
<@U0289USNA> <@U026PT0D7> I just learned there's an ImageOptim plugin for Xcode. <https://imageoptim.com/xcode.html>
Apparently Xcode can "undo ImageOptim's savings."
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LKnqECcg6Gw>

attachments.title: Computer Color is Broken
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Computer Color is Broken

text: hey <@U02618EV1> <@U0289USNA> happened to visit smallbatch website today for some reason, looks like the wrong minified js file got deployed to production at some point, the beer levels aren't right <http://www.smallbatchws.com/>
Oh, I fixed something there a couple of weeks back.
Don't know if I caused this and missed the error or something else happened.
<@U02613K0X> Would you be able to concat and minify the js and push from your mac?
yep. can do it now
we need to make sure the js files compile correctly for the animations to work before we deploy
Yes. In the past I used the get errors on my console. Looks like whatever the thing causing the issue isn't triggering an error anymore. At least on my machine with the what I have installed.
<@U02613K0X> Make sure you pull my changes from BB too.

Yep I pulled them! Remember we determined the difference is in how the javascript is getting concatenated/minified/uglified/etc, so messed up animation won't necessarily generate any errors, we need to check for them to be working in the browser(s) before deploying
Got it. My bad. I had been months since I worked on that project and I completely forgot about that whole problem.
np. I pulled in your latest commits and updated production and staging
Thank you.
Just a thought... What if on small batch we stopped running uglify. Concat and minify shouldn't cause any technical problem...
Hmmm. Interesting. Will give that a quick test when I'm back on my Mac.
<@U0289USNA> i was considering the same thing today. seems like a way better alternative.
OK, just checked and it doesn't look like uglify is the culprit.
We only uglify the scripts file when we deploy to a server but I just tried running the site locally —without uglify— and still get the same bug. Will look into concat tomorrow.
